Description: Rim and bowl sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup-skyphos; interior glazed black with traces of ivy wreath in added white; exterior: rim glazed; in handle zone red-figure decoration; from left, part of enclosed palmette with central leaf breaking encircling line; upper part of youth in himation, to right with right hand raised; nude athlete (head, back, and part of buttock remaining), to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0733) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 112, pl. 57, no. 39)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
